result.execSummary:
The defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court WAIVES All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

- No contact with firearms.

*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deondrick Terrell Byrd

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (20 pages) commencing MAY 10, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, concurrent to any othe sentence.  The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court WAIVES All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Filed: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas, who is in trial.
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to counts 2 and 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05/10/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
Branch 45 in trial.  Case spun to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd not in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defendant in custody on a revocation.  Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd not in court, in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense counsel recently appointed and requests an adjourned pretrial date and bail/bond hearing.  Defendant to be produced for next court date. 

Victim present in court and requests the Court lift the no contact order.  Court denies request at this time. 

Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference and bail/bond hearing in Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:      A.I.T. (DOB: 2/11/82),        AJS  9/3/83;       SNS: 3-17-88
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Deondrick Terrell Byrd in custody.  
Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
